DOS: Yes (FAT16 from DOS 3.0, FAT16B from DOS 3.31, FAT16X from DOS 7.0)
Minix: Partial (via dosdir, dosread, doswrite, not FAT16X)

Windows 9x: Yes (with 3rd-party drivers like “Paragon NTFS for Win98”,“DiskInternals NTFS Reader”?
macOS: Yes natively read only, write support with Paragon NTFS or ntfs-3g

Linux: Partial - writing support only to unjournalled FS
Yes - until 2.1.20 Experimental port available to 2.6.32 and later [69][70]

Windows NT: Yes with Paragon ExtFS [71] or partial with Ext2 IFS[72] or ext2fsd[73]
macOS: Yes with Paragon ExtFS [74] or ext2fsx

Windows NT: Yes with Paragon ExtFS [71] or partial with Ext2 IFS[72] or ext2fsd[73]
macOS: Yes with Paragon ExtFS [74] or partial with ext2fsx (journal not updated on writing)

Windows NT: Yes with Paragon ExtFS [71] or partial with Ext2 IFS[72] or ext2fsd[73]
FreeBSD: Partial support in kernel since version 10.1 (read-only)[75][76]

Linux: Yes as an external kernel module
Yes with FUSE[79] or as an external kernel module[80]

Windows NT: Yes (from Windows Server 2012 and from Windows 8.1)
Linux: Partial - with Paragon ReFS for Linux

Windows NT: Partial (There are ports of unsquashfs and mksquashfs.)
macOS: Partial (There are ports of unsquashfs and mksquashfs.)
FreeBSD: Partial (There are ports of unsquashfs and mksquashfs and fusefs-port.[83][84])
